place.name: BLYBOROUGH
place.gazetteerText: BLYBOROUGH, a parish in Gainsborough district, Lincoln; 2¾ miles SSE of Northorpe r. station, and 9 ENE of Gainsborough. It has a post office under Kirton-Lindsey. Acres, 2,345. Real property, £2,911. Pop., 209. Houses, 41. The property is divided between two. Blyborough Hall is the seat ofLuard, Esq. There are some mineral springs. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £519.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
